title: JsonTypeInfo.As.EXTERNAL_PROPERTY and Date property
body:
Cannot serialize class with the following signature:

``` java
public class Test {

    @JsonTypeInfo(use = JsonTypeInfo.Id.NAME,
                  property = "type",
                  visible = true,
                  include = JsonTypeInfo.As.EXTERNAL_PROPERTY,
                  defaultImpl = String.class)
    @JsonSubTypes({
                          @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = Date.class, name = "date"),
                          @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = String.class, name = "")
                  })
    private final Object value;
}
```

The stacktrace is:

```
com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerationException: Can not write number, expecting field name
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.core.base.GeneratorBase._reportError(GeneratorBase.java:424) ~[jackson-core-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.core.json.UTF8JsonGenerator._verifyValueWrite(UTF8JsonGenerator.java:945) ~[jackson-core-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.core.json.UTF8JsonGenerator.writeNumber(UTF8JsonGenerator.java:803) ~[jackson-core-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider.defaultSerializeDateValue(SerializerProvider.java:785) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.DateSerializer.serialize(DateSerializer.java:60) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.DateSerializer.serialize(DateSerializer.java:16) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.StdScalarSerializer.serializeWithType(StdScalarSerializer.java:44) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanPropertyWriter.serializeAsField(BeanPropertyWriter.java:546) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.BeanSerializerBase.serializeFields(BeanSerializerBase.java:551) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanSerializer.serialize(BeanSerializer.java:143) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.CollectionSerializer.serializeContents(CollectionSerializer.java:118) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.CollectionSerializer.serializeContents(CollectionSerializer.java:24) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.AsArraySerializerBase.serialize(AsArraySerializerBase.java:180) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanPropertyWriter.serializeAsField(BeanPropertyWriter.java:544) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.BeanSerializerBase.serializeFields(BeanSerializerBase.java:551) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.BeanSerializer.serialize(BeanSerializer.java:143) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.impl.IndexedListSerializer.serializeContents(IndexedListSerializer.java:94) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.impl.IndexedListSerializer.serializeContents(IndexedListSerializer.java:21) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.AsArraySerializerBase.serialize(AsArraySerializerBase.java:180) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.DefaultSerializerProvider.serializeValue(DefaultSerializerProvider.java:120) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
    at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectWriter.writeValue(ObjectWriter.java:457) ~[jackson-databind-2.1.1.jar:2.1.1]
```

I have a strong feeling that this could happen with any class which could be serialized as a simple value (number or something else) instead of the ordinary object ({..}).
